content: This is the FHIR Developer Days 2016 channel for the HL7v2 and FHIR track.

Hi all,
please let me know about your specific interests and expectations for the HL7 v2 -> FHIR Track. I'd be happy to include your suggestions in the agenda.

For those participating in the HL7v2 track and looking for a way to get started, please read
http://wiki.hl7.org/index.php?title=Version_2_-_FHIR_Mapping_Scenarios
I will be using the scenario "2. ADT (single source system)" to explain the principles and challenges of V2 to FHIR mapping. Feel free to use the test data provided in the scenario description to test your implementation during the hands-on workshop.
If you are interested in other V2 mapping scenarios (e.g. V2 ORU-> FHIR or FHIR->V2), or planning to implement these during the workshop, please let me know.

@Simone Heckmann I'm new to connectathons - Is there some software we should install ahead of the conference, or some Github repo to clone, or anything else we should do as a preparation of our laptops?
No need. You bring whatever Dev Tools you want to work with. You can rund your Tests against any of the public test Servers. Having a REST Client installed may prove to be helpful.
I recommend the RESTclient addon for Firefox

Hi all,
thanks for attending todays tutorial.
Here are the slides from the presentation:
GF_V2-Mapping_DevDays_2016_hl7.pdf
Thanks for a great HL7v2 -> FHIR presentation today. Very interesting topic
If you have any post-DevDays questions about V2 mapping, please subscribe to the dedicated zulip channel: https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/v2.20to.20FHIR
Just in case someone misses me at the table: I'm in room Chris with the Student presentations...
